Text: "The president of the United States must be part of the solution not the problem. This president today is part of the problem and accelerates it," Biden says.
Every major network carried Trump live but none carried either of Biden's two events today where he addressed police brutality. Total journalistic malpractice ; repeat of 2016

I am really outraged today. Not outraged at what Trump/his criminal cronies are doing but at everyone who normalized this, refused to heed warnings/red flags convincing themselves and America that our institutions will save us, refused to admit we are heading into a mafia state

Trump needed a pep talk from Mommy Putin before he could work up the nerve to come out from under the bed in his bunker. He had to tear gas his own citizens to show his face in public because we hate him and he fears us.Trump is a bully trying to look tough. Don't fall for it.

How low can this president go?President Trump ordered federal authorities to fire tear gas at peaceful protesters so that he could hold a photo op to appear like a tough guy.His words are empty. His actions reveal his true nature.
This is the guy that the media and left just spent days telling us was a coward hiding in his basement. RT if you agree that this is what leadership looks like! #MAGA https://t.co/M053YrXlGU
he basically saying that he going to start a war and k*ll people for protesting again police brutality. this man is a fascist. he is a tyrant. I'm disgusted. https://t.co/uqc1A07Iyj
It is shameful the UK Government won't condemn Trump.Now is the time to speak up for justice and equality.#BlackLivesMatter #JusticeForGeorgeFloyd

You may think it's only a small thing that the military used helicopters to intimidate American civilians in the nation's capital. It's not. A line was crossed tonight. There will be other lines. This is Trump conditioning them to cross those lines.

Joe Biden begins his remarks: " 'I can't breathe. I can't breathe.' George Floyd's last words. But they didn't die with him. They're still being heard. Echoing across this nation....'I can't breathe.' It's a wake-up call for our nation. For all of us."
